content.text:
# Battle of al-Qaryatayn

| result            = Muslim victoryRashidun Caliphate conquers Al-Qaryatayn
| combatant1        = Rashidun Caliphate
| combatant2        = Ghassanids
| commander1        = Khalid ibn al-Walid
| commander2        = Jabala ibn al-Ayham
| strength1         = 9,000
| strength2         = 10,000
| casualties1       = Very few
| casualties2       = Unknown, but more than Muslims
| campaignbox       =
}}
Battle of al-Qaryatayn was a minor battle between the Christian Ghassanid Arab allies of the Byzantine Empire, and the Rashidun Caliphate army. It was fought after Khalid ibn al-Walid had conquered Tadmur in Syria. His army marched to al-Qaryatayn, the inhabitants of which resisted the Muslim army. They were fought, defeated and plundered. This resulted in the conquest of Al-Qaryatayn by the Muslim forces.
References
* A.I. Akram, The Sword of Allah: Khalid bin al-Waleed, His Life and Campaigns, Nat. Publishing. House, Rawalpindi (1970) .
External links
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20020224232028/http://www.swordofallah.com/html/bookhome.htm A.I. Akram, The Sword of Allah: Khalid bin al-Waleed, His Life and Campaigns Lahore, 1969]
